storyInfo: Noir Corne and the Felyne Scholar fall into the Rathalos's lair and speculate on its status based on the clues around them. Just as Noir Corne explains to the Felyne Originium's influence on Terra, a third voice can be heard from deep inside the cave...

attributes.content: Mrrooooooww!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Aaaaaaaaaaaahhh!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Mrrooooooww!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Mrrowaaaaah... Now you've got me mrowing!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Mrrow! We're falling!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: What are you talkin—Argh, the wind's too strong! My mask!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: We're falling!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: I'm holding on as tight as I can! You won't fall!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Rathalos! The Rathalos is falling!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: The mask is covering my eyes! I can't see anything!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Noir Corne! Noir Cornnnne! L-Look what the R-Ra-Rathalos is charging toward!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: T-Toward what?!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: We're about to crash!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Hold on... Finally, my mask's back in place!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Ahh! We're going to crash!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Meow! My notes... My tail... All fine. Thank heavens!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Where are we? It's dark here...
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Corne...! Noir Corne! Are you still alive?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Mrrow... I can only see half your body there. Noir Corne, don't die...
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: I'm okay... but could you stop tugging on my leg?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: I have a lamp in my equipment bag. Turn it on.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Lamp? What's that? Mew mean this thing?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Yeah, now flip the switch at the bottom.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Mrow! That's bright! But it's not hot at all... How do you do it?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Another thing. My horn... It's stuck in this rock. Could you come help me out?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Your horn's... stuck in the rock...! Meowhahaha!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Hey! Don't laugh!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: I'm on meow way.
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Climb up from over there. Ahh! Don't climb me! And definitely don't grab that!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Here I am... Is this where you're stuck? Wham!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Oww... My butt.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Where's the Rathalos? Did you see it?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: It went inside.
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: The opening of this cave's too high up. It'd take us too much work to climb up without help. We need to find a way to signal Yato, but we also can't lose track of the Rathalos...
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Wait, where are we anyway?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: I was going to ask mew!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: The Rathalos went down the cave, and the cave only further down... Maybe it's connected to the one closer to the village. Looks like we'll have to head that way to check it out.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Hey, Scholar! Wait up! What's the rush?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Meow! We need to hurry!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: There are so meowny mysteries! The laws of nature here aren't all that diffurent from where we're from, but there are all these situations I can't wrap my head around! The Rathalos is acting way too oddly!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Oddly? That new Felyne mentioned something about it being abnormal, too.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: I'll explain to mew as we walk!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: The Rathalos burrowed itself down here... Purrhaps the cause of its odd behavior can be found here, too!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: I swear this on the name of a furmer Royal Pawleontology Scriveners scholar! I will get to the bottom of this!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Noir Corne... come check this out.
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: I'm coming—Goodness, this stinks... Huh?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Scholar... Are these...
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: All animal carcasses... all shredded and torn apart by the Rathalos.
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Shellbeasts, hornbeasts, fowlbeasts... so many different beasts... Did it kill all these animals for food? Are these... leftovers?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: No, a Rathalos's bite can crush even bones. There is no way it would leave behind so many carcasses.
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: They all look very complete, too. They were killed, but there are no chew marks or signs of them having been eaten...
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Come. Let's check out what's up ahead.
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Mrow! How could this be...?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: What did you find?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: The carcasses here have all been burnt to a crisp... They were killed and dragged all the way down here, but it still spat fire at them. There's no way it could've eaten any of these.
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Is it... angry?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Look here. This, this, and this! Not one of them... It didn't eat even a single one of them!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Purrhaps... the Rathalos can't eat Terran creatures?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Could that explain uh... how it's abnormal?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: I don't know... Hunger can change its behavior, but it's hard to say for sure that's the reason...
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Why? I don't get it at all!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Based on my observation data, Terran creatures follow the same growth patterns as where we're from. Besides, I ate the same food as you, and there's nothing wrong with me meow!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: This is just a guess, but... what if it's not caused by the food, but by the... Originium on its skin?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: You mean Rathalos caught Oripathy?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: —! Look at that!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: What mrow?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Quick! Help me get all these animals out of the way. The dirt, too.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: It stinks! Why can't you do it yourself?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Well, you tricked me into holding that fincatching rod for you. This is payback.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Mrow? *Hiss*... I'm mad! Mad, I tell you, mrow!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Wait, cut it out.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: ...I think I know why there are those traces of Originium on the Rathalos's body now.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Are you talking about the holes we're digging? What could they pawssibly imply?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: These are tracks left behind by Originium mining. The area underneath is most likely...
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: An Originium mine.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: If this mine is why the villagers have been going so far to hide this cave from us, then that would explain everything.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Wait! What do you mean? Meow exactly does it explain anything?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Considering Higashi's current situation and its dwindling resources... a private Originium mine that's hidden from the outside world could bring them piles of cash even if all they do is sell crude ore.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: But if any outsiders—maybe even greater forces—were to find out about their hidden mine, it could very well get taken over by force. It might even put their lives in danger.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: So what you're saying is, Originium is a kind of meowneral that's find in the earth, and the villagers have been digging it up?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: That's right.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: And you people do that on a regular basis?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Yep.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: As I recall, you said Originium can cause an incurable disease called Oripathy, or even a cat-astrophic disaster that tears even the land and the sky apart...
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Exactly.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: So why could you pawssibly want to dig it up?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Uh... because it's an energy source, I guess?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Energy source? You can burn wood and oil for heat, and you can boil water to purr-pel machines. Can't you people do any of that fur energy?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: I can't think of a good reason fur willingly exposing yourselves to something so dangerous!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: What did the Doctor say again... We Terrans use Originium through Originium Arts...
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Thanks to advancements in Originium engine technology, Originium became widely used as an industrial energy source. And in the past, it was also often used for casting Arts...
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: I don't know any Arts, though. How I can explain this to you with something else...? Oh, hand me the light.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: What are mew doing with it? Mrowah! Don't take it apart! You'll purrt it out!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Here. This is what I'm talking about.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Huh? It's still lit up?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Take a look at this. This is a battery. It's what powers the light bulb up here, and that's how it's lit up.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: What does that have to do with Originium?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: The battery has Originium in it, too. There's also this... what do you call it... Arts Unit? That's the thing that turns the battery's Originium into electrical currents that light up the bulb.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: So it lights up beclawse of Originium?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Not only that, the light bulb, the outer shell, and all the parts inside were mass produced in a factory.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Mass produced?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: It's when you make the same thing over and over on a large scale. Take this exploration lamp. A huge factory can make over a thousand of them in a day.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: A thousand?! That's so convenient! Could the clothes all the villagers wear pawssibly be made in those factories, too?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: That's right. The factory uses machines to build these parts, and what's driving those machines is called an Originium engine.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: And they need Originium to function. That's how it is in most places here.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: So Terra's technology... and even its civilizations are built on a furndation of Originium.
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: I guess that's about it?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: But our Hunters don't have lamps, or the kind of clothes mew wear. The lamp is convenient, I'll give mew that...
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: But even without something as dangerous as Originium, we get by just fine.
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: It should be pawssible to replace it with something else here too, shouldn't it?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Are these Hunters common where you guys are from?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Of course. If we leave the meownsters be, they could pose significant threats to the villagers' safety, and our livelihoods depend on the meowterials you get out of them.
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: So... are all the hunts these hunters go on safe?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: No... Most of the time, there are dangers everywhere. You're more likely to fail a hunt than succeed.
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: And there's only a very small number of truly skilled hunters. When they are up against truly tricky monsters, meowst hunters end up losing their lives.
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Then our Originium's actually not a whole lot different from your monsters.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Mrow? What do you mean?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Both Originium and monsters are unpreventable threats, but they both also give us the opportunity to survive.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Mrrow...
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: You probably won't see one, but... Catastrophes are actually very common here in Terra. Most folks live in the nomadic cities, and each city can have tens of thousands of residents.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: When a Catastrophe is about to strike, the entire city starts moving.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: A city with tens of thousands of residents... moving... That sounds moewvelous. How do you move something that big?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Originium. Only the energy hidden in Originium can move a nomadic city. No other energy source comes close.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: I can't believe this, mrow...
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: We all definitely understand that using Originium can cause Catastrophes.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: But... when Catastrophe strikes, if you want to survive, even if all you have nearby is a twig or branch floating in a puddle, you're bound to grab it.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: It doesn't matter if it has thorns... That's the least of your worries.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Before nomadic cities were invented, before we started using Originium at the scale we do now, many more people died from Catastrophes.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Terra... sounds so scary, mrow.
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Those thorns may end up cutting your fingers, but a Catastrophe's not going to end just because of your pain. You have no choice but to hold on... and hold on for dear life.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: And it doesn't matter how hard you look. Until you find a smooth tree branch that won't cut you, that's all you can do.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: It doesn't matter how difficult it all is. You just have to grit your teeth and live on...
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Noir Corne, I can hardly call you smart just for this, but purrhaps you have a point...
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Thinking about it now, the difficulties we face aren't all that diffurent.
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: The materials we need to forge weapons that can take on the fiercest beasts likewise come from fierce beasts, and behind that must be a countless number of sacrifices too...
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: There are Hunters who never return from their hunts, Commission members who fall while exploring the New World, and plenty of Scriveners who disappeared without a trace while observing dangerous creatures for data...
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: *sigh*... looks like no matter where mew are, people are fragile, and the world is a cruel place.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: But even if all that suffering is inevitable, and you have to pay the price to survive, must innocent lives be sacrificed too?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: I've never heard of things like that where I'm from... Things like Originium which makes the innocent suffer.
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: They don't catch Oripathy because they wanted to, and they won't even get to live without treatment. How could that pawssibly be right?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Of course it's not right.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Mrow! So quick to answer!
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Which is why somebody has to step forward and take on the burden of showing everyone else the way forward.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Hello? Is anybody there?
What's that noise?
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: Did someone just talk?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Stop chatting! Look over here!
I've been stuck in here for three days now. Could you come over and move the stuff blocking this door?!
She's asking us for help... Where are you? We're coming right away!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Whoa, watch out! There's about to be another beast outbreak.
Beast outbreak?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: You can more or less figure it out from the name, can't you? It's an outbreak of all the animals in the forest going berserk at once.
I think I hear a familiar noise, too.
attributes.name: Felyne Scholar

attributes.content: I can hear it, too. It's not coming again, is it?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Whenever you see a surge of animals here, you can bet they're all Infected.
